Interface IExtensibleSyndicationObject

Defines generalized extension properties, methods, indexers and events that a value type or class implements to create a type-specific implementation of extension properties, methods, indexers and events.

Namespace: Argotic.Extensions
Assembly: Argotic.Extensions.dll
Syntax
public interface IExtensibleSyndicationObject

Properties

| Improve this Doc View Source

Extensions

Gets or sets the syndication extensions applied to the syndication entity.

Declaration
IEnumerable<ISyndicationExtension> Extensions { get; set; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<ISyndicationExtension>

A System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable<T> collection of ISyndicationExtension objects that represent syndication extensions applied to the syndication entity.
Exceptions
Type Condition
System.ArgumentNullException

The value is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
See Also
SyndicationExtension

HasExtensions

Gets a value indicating whether gets a value indicating if the syndication entity has one or more syndication extensions applied to it.

Declaration
bool HasExtensions { get; }
Property Value
Type Description
System.Boolean

true if the Extensions collection contains one or more ISyndicationExtension objects, otherwise returns false.

| Improve this Doc View Source

FindExtension(Predicate<ISyndicationExtension>)

Searches for a syndication extension that matches the conditions defined by the specified predicate, and returns the first occurrence within the Extensions collection.

Declaration
ISyndicationExtension FindExtension(Predicate<ISyndicationExtension> match)
Parameters
Type Name Description
System.Predicate<ISyndicationExtension> match

The System.Predicate<T> delegate that defines the conditions of the ISyndicationExtension to search for.
Returns
Type Description
ISyndicationExtension

The first syndication extension that matches the conditions defined by the specified predicate, if found; otherwise, the default value for ISyndicationExtension.
Remarks

The System.Predicate<T> is a delegate to a method that returns true if the object passed to it matches the conditions defined in the delegate. The elements of the current Extensions are individually passed to the System.Predicate<T> delegate, moving forward in the Extensions, starting with the first element and ending with the last element. Processing is stopped when a match is found.

Exceptions
Type Condition
System.ArgumentNullException

The match is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
| Improve this Doc View Source
